trans-unit.source: Runbook settings
trans-unit.target: Runbook settings

trans-unit.source: Describes the configuration settings for a runbook in Azure Automation and how to change them using both the Azure Management Portal and Windows PowerShell.
trans-unit.target: Describes the configuration settings for a runbook in Azure Automation and how to change them using both the Azure Management Portal and Windows PowerShell.

trans-unit.source: Runbook settings
trans-unit.target: Runbook settings

trans-unit.source: Each runbook in Azure Automation has multiple settings that help it to be identified and to change its logging behavior.
trans-unit.target: Each runbook in Azure Automation has multiple settings that help it to be identified and to change its logging behavior.

trans-unit.source: Each of these settings is described below followed by procedures on how to modify them.
trans-unit.target: Each of these settings is described below followed by procedures on how to modify them.

trans-unit.source: Settings
trans-unit.target: Settings

trans-unit.source: Name and description
trans-unit.target: Name and description

trans-unit.source: You cannot change the name of a runbook after it has been created.
trans-unit.target: You cannot change the name of a runbook after it has been created.

trans-unit.source: The Description is optional and can be up to 512 characters.
trans-unit.target: The Description is optional and can be up to 512 characters.

trans-unit.source: Tags
trans-unit.target: Tags

trans-unit.source: Tags allow you to assign distinct words and phrases to help identify a runbook.
trans-unit.target: Tags allow you to assign distinct words and phrases to help identify a runbook.

trans-unit.source: For example, when you submit a runbook to the <link><linkText>Runbook Gallery</linkText><title></title></link>, you specify particular tags to identify which categories the runbook should be listed in.
trans-unit.target: For example, when you submit a runbook to the <link><linkText>Runbook Gallery</linkText><title></title></link>, you specify particular tags to identify which categories the runbook should be listed in.

trans-unit.source: You can specify multiple tags for a runbook by separating them with commas.
trans-unit.target: You can specify multiple tags for a runbook by separating them with commas.

trans-unit.source: Logging
trans-unit.target: Logging

trans-unit.source: By default, Verbose and Progress records are not written to job history.
trans-unit.target: By default, Verbose and Progress records are not written to job history.

trans-unit.source: You can change the settings for a particular runbook to log these records.
trans-unit.target: You can change the settings for a particular runbook to log these records.

trans-unit.source: For more information on these records, see <link><linkText>Runbook Output and Messages</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on these records, see <link><linkText>Runbook Output and Messages</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Changing runbook settings
trans-unit.target: Changing runbook settings

trans-unit.source: Changing runbook settings with the Azure Management Portal
trans-unit.target: Changing runbook settings with the Azure Management Portal

trans-unit.source: You can change settings for a runbook in the Azure Management Portal from the Configure page for the runbook.
trans-unit.target: You can change settings for a runbook in the Azure Management Portal from the Configure page for the runbook.

trans-unit.source: In the Azure Management Portal, select Automation and then then click the name of an automation account.
trans-unit.target: In the Azure Management Portal, select Automation and then then click the name of an automation account.

trans-unit.source: Select the Runbooks tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the Runbooks tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the name of a runbook.
trans-unit.target: Click the name of a runbook.

trans-unit.source: Select the Configure tab.
trans-unit.target: Select the Configure tab.

trans-unit.source: Changing runbook settings with Windows PowerShell
trans-unit.target: Changing runbook settings with Windows PowerShell

trans-unit.source: You can use the <link><linkText>Set-AzureAutomationRunbook</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet to change the settings for a runbook.
trans-unit.target: You can use the <link><linkText>Set-AzureAutomationRunbook</linkText><title></title></link> cmdlet to change the settings for a runbook.

trans-unit.source: If you want to specify multiple tags, you can either provide an array or a single string with comma delimited values to the Tags parameter.
trans-unit.target: If you want to specify multiple tags, you can either provide an array or a single string with comma delimited values to the Tags parameter.

trans-unit.source: You can get the current tags with the <link><linkText>Get-AzureAutomationRunbook</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: You can get the current tags with the <link><linkText>Get-AzureAutomationRunbook</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: The following sample commands show how to set the properties for a runbook.
trans-unit.target: The following sample commands show how to set the properties for a runbook.

trans-unit.source: This sample adds three tags to the existing tags and specifies that verbose records should be logged.
trans-unit.target: This sample adds three tags to the existing tags and specifies that verbose records should be logged.
